info.instructorInformation: This skill station involves a middle-aged patient who experienced a rollover with a riding lawn mower. The patient requires airway/breathing management, hemorrhage control, immobilization, and rapid transport to a trauma center. Follow the written scenario, and provide information to all team members as the scenario progresses or as the team members ask.

patientInformation.moulage: Multiple lacerations to upper and lower extremities; partial amputation of right lower extremity with active bleeding; multiple bruises to chest and abdomen; flail segment to right upper chest; pale, cool, and diaphoretic skin
patientInformation.actions: Opens eyes to pain and becomes progressively more unresponsive

info.dispatchInfo: You and your partners work for a transporting EMS agency and have been dispatched to a residential housing development for a lawn mower accident. It is 1330 hr on a Saturday afternoon and the temperature is 90°F (32°C). You are 5 minutes away from a level III trauma center and 25 minutes from a level I trauma center.
info.sceneAssessment: You arrive at a suburban yard where you observe a large riding lawn mower on its side at the bottom of an 8-ft (2.5-m) hill. A bystander is holding a towel to the patient’s right lower leg. As you approach the patient, the bystander tells you that he saw the mower tip over while the patient was driving it.

R.initial: 38, shallow; LS clear and equal with crepitus on right
R.good: 12, LS clear and equal with crepitus on right
R.bad: 38, shallow; LS clear and equal with crepitus on right

SAMPLE.E: Riding a lawnmower on an incline and it rolled over the patient

assessmentFindings.assess-injury-mechanism: Patient experienced a rollover while riding a lawn mower
assessmentFindings.assess-need-additional-help: Additional EMS is on the way.
assessmentFindings.assess-patient-condition: You arrive at a suburban yard where you observe a large riding lawn mower on its side at the bottom of an 8-ft (2.5-m) hill. A bystander is holding a towel to the patient’s right lower leg. As you approach the patient, the bystander tells you that he saw the mower tip over while the patient was driving it.
assessmentFindings.assess-loc: Opens eyes to pain and becomes progressively more unresponsive
assessmentFindings.assess-life-threats: Major external hemorrhage at lower right leg
assessmentFindings.assess-major-bleeding: Major external hemorrhage at lower right leg
assessmentFindings.assess-head-dcap-btls: Multiple lacerations to face and scalp; minor bleeding
assessmentFindings.assess-palpate-chest: Flail segment to right upper chest
assessmentFindings.assess-auscultate-chest: Lungs sound clear and equal with crepitus on right
assessmentFindings.assess-legs-dcap-btls: Amputation of right leg at ankle

children.label: Takes or verbalizes appropriate PPE precautions.
Determines the mechanism of injury/nature of illness
Assesses patient response to airway management
Assesses patient’s response to breathing management
Assesses patient’s response to managaging severe bleeding
Obtains (or directs assistant to obtain) baseline vital signs
Prompt students to state what they are looking/listening/feeling for throughout.

interventionFormsMenu.label: Transfers patient to ambulance as needed
Checks and modifies interventions as needed

criticalCriteria.label: Uses or orders a dangerous or inappropriate intervention

children.prompt: Which type of airway would you try to apply?
When would you use a nasopharyngeal airway instead of an oropharyngeal airway?

children.label: When patient has a gag reflex

What size needle do you want to use?

children.prompt: When do you know when to stop tightening the tourniquet?

children.label: Place or maintain patient in supine position

Is this a “load and go” patient?

Would you transport this patient by air or ground?
Would you use lights and sirens with this patient?

children.label: Transfer to stretcher on long backboard

children.label: Which vitals would you like to reassess?
